docs.title: Smart Building Model
docs.text:
A LinkML schema for sites, buildings, spaces, equipment, and points used in smart-building data exchanges.

URI: https://www.sbco.or.jp/ont/schema

Name: building_model

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description Any Any resource or value KeyBoolMapEntry map(string -> boolean) の1エントリ KeyMapOfStringMapEntry map(string -> map(string -> string)) の1エントリ KeyStringMapEntry map(string -> string) の1エントリ Point A sensor, actuator, or data point associated with equipment PointExt A point (sensor/actuator) in a smart building context Resource Base class for all resources Agent An entity that can act or be acted upon Organization An organization such as a company, institution, or association ArchitectureArea Describes business-relevant area measurements typically associated with archi... ArchitectureCapacity Describes business-relevant capacity measurements typically associated with a... Asset Something which is placed inside of a building, but is not an integral part o... Equipment An equipment asset installed in a space EquipmentExt An equipment asset installed in a space BuildingElement A part of the building structure Information Abstract base class for information resources such as documents, images, medi... Document A document providing information about a building element or asset Geometry REC Geometry のプレースホルダ（詳細は別途拡張） Georeference REC Georeference のプレースホルダ（詳細は別途拡張） Image An image file containing visual information Media A media file such as audio or video content PostalAddress A postal address Schema A schema definition file Space A contiguous part of the physical world that contains or can contain sub-spac... Architecture A designed/landscaped (or potentially designed/landscaped) part of the physic... Building A building which is part of a site Level A building storey OutdoorSpace An outdoor space associated with a site or building Room A room within a building Site A piece of land upon which zero or more buildings may be situated Zone A sub-zone within or outside of a building defined to support some technology...

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Slot Description address Address of the architecture adjacentElement Building element adjacent to this architecture aggregate Aggregation function or method for point data processing altitude Altitude above sea level in meters architectedBy Agent or resource that architected this structure area Area of the architecture assetTag Asset identification tag capacity Capacity of the architecture checksum Checksum or hash of the information content commissionedBy Agent or resource that commissioned this asset commissioningDate Date when the asset was commissioned constructedBy Agent or resource that constructed this architecture containsElement Building element contained within this architecture coordinates Geographic coordinates defining the geofence boundary customProperties map(string -> map(string -> string)) customTags map(string -> boolean) description A textual description of the resource deviceType Device Type documentation Documentation related to this asset entries Nested map entries feeds Equipment or system that this equipment feeds flag Boolean flag value format MIME type or format identifier for the information geometry Polygon representing the spatial extent of this Space georeference A georeference creates a relationship between the local coordinate system use... hasPart The subject is composed in part of the entity given by the object hasPoint Point associated with this architecture hasQuantity Physical quantity measured by this point hasSubstance Substance associated with this point id Unique identifier within the schema identifiers map(string -> string) initialCost Initial cost of the asset installationArea Parent installation area installationDate Date when the asset was installed installedBy Agent or resource that installed this asset intersectingElement Building element intersecting with this architecture intervalCapability Polling period (period speed that the device is capable of) IPAddress IP address of the asset isFedBy Resource that feeds this architecture isLocationOf Subject is the physical location encapsulating the object isPartOf isPointOf Equipment that this point belongs to key Key of the map entry language Language code (ISO 639-1) of the information content levelNumber Floor or level number within a building locatedIn Space where this asset is located MACAddress MAC address of the asset maintenanceInterval Maintenance interval duration manufacturedBy Agent or resource that manufactured this asset maxPresValue Maximum plausible reading memberOf Indicates membership in an organization minPresValue Minimum plausible reading modelNumber Model number of the asset mountedOn Building element on which this asset is mounted name Machine or Human-readable name operatedBy Agent or resource that operates this architecture operationalStageCount The number of operational stages supported by this equipment ownedBy Agent or resource that owns this architecture owns Indicates ownership of some thing, e panel Parent panel pointSpecification Point specification category as shown in equipment point list pointType Point type - a profile or template name used to refer to the telemetry format... radius Radius in meters for circular geofences scale Scale factor for raw value conversion serialNumber Serial number of the asset servicedBy Agent or resource that services this asset size Size of the information resource in bytes targetArea Target area for this resource turnoverDate Date when the asset was turned over unit Measurement unit (enum key; symbol can be taken from annotations) url URL or URI pointing to the information resource value Value of the map entry version Version identifier for the information weight Weight of the asset

docs.title: Enumerations
docs.text: Enumeration Description AggregateEnum Aggregation functions for point data processing PointSpecificationEnum Point specification categories for equipment point lists QuantityEnum Physical quantities that can be measured or monitored by points SubstanceEnum Types of substances that can be fed between equipment UnitEnum Allowed measurement units

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Type Description Boolean A binary (true or false) value Curie a compact URI Date a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar DateOrDatetime Either a date or a datetime Datetime The combination of a date and time Decimal A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal speci... Double A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification DurationString ISO 8601 duration format Float A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer An integer Jsonpath A string encoding a JSON Path Jsonpointer A string encoding a JSON Pointer Ncname Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model Objectidentifier A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model Sparqlpath A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path String A character string Time A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular... Uri a complete URI Uriorcurie a URI or a CURIE

docs.title: Class: Architecture
docs.text:
A designed/landscaped (or potentially designed/landscaped) part of the physical world that has a 3D spatial extent. E.g., a building site, a building, levels within the building, rooms, etc.

  • NOTE: this is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly

URI: rec:Architecture

    click Architecture href "../Architecture/"
      Space <|-- Architecture
        click Space href "../Space/"

      Architecture <|-- Level
        click Level href "../Level/"

docs.title: Class: Space
docs.text:
A contiguous part of the physical world that contains or can contain sub-spaces. E.g., a Region can contain many Sites, which in turn can contain many Buildings.

docs.title: Slot: georeference
docs.text:
A georeference creates a relationship between the local coordinate system used within a building (e.g., measured in meters) and a geographic coordinate system (e.g., lat, long, alt), such that locally placed Spaces can be resolved and rendered in that geographic coordinate system (e.g., for mapping purposes).

URI: rec:georeference Alias: georeference
